page.title: 10Shobrooke Park Farm.
page.content: FARMING. Dr. Shelley is trying to restore Shobrooke Park Farm as it has not been touched for 100 years. The entrance to the park when he came was all unlevel and rough so he grew corn and then levelled it off, left it and it would turn into grass. He had a farming partner called (PETER COLEMAN and together they own about 400 sheep and 100 cattle. The cattle were eating the beech and oak shoots and they are poisonous and very dangerous to the animals, three died and alot had terrible pains in their stomachs. He had built a farm house and you could hardly see it. Alot of the fields are being ploughed and re-seeded with trees. Dr. Shelley is planting alot of corn for corn fields and grass fields too.
